org.tensorics.core.util

Class Maybe<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tensorics.core.util.Maybe<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type to carry.

    public class Maybe<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class implements the concept of a "Maybe" or "Try" Optional. A Maybe<T> either carries a T or an exception that occurred when producing it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static interface  Maybe.ThrowingConsumer<T>

      static interface  Maybe.ThrowingRunnable

        public static <T> Maybe<T> ofException(java.lang.Throwable exception)
        Construct an "unsuccessful" Maybe containing an exception.
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to wrap
        Returns:
        the unsuccessful Maybe object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the exception is null

      • ofValue

        public static <T> Maybe<T> ofValue(T value)
        Construct a "successful" Maybe containing a value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to wrap
        Returns:
        the successful Maybe object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value is null

      • ofVoid

        public static Maybe<java.lang.Void> ofVoid()
        Construct a "successful" Maybe<Void> containing a null value. This special Maybe objects represents a successful execution with no result (e.g. a void function). Note that ONLY Maybe<Void> is allowed to carry a null value.
        Returns:
        the successful Maybe<Void> object

      • exception

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.Throwable> exception()
        Returns the exception, if any.
        Returns:
        the contained exception, or Optional.empty() if none occurred.

      • hasException

        public boolean hasException()
        Returns true if this Maybe is in an "unsuccessful" state, i.e. containing an exception.
        Returns:
        true if an exception is present, false otherwise

      • value

        public T value()
        Retrieve the value stored in this Maybe. If an exception is stored, this method will re-throw it wrapped in a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        the value
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this Maybe objects contains an exception

      • throwOnException

        public void throwOnException()
        Throw the contained exception, wrapped in a RuntimeException, if any. If called on a "successful" Maybe, this method does nothing.

      • attempt

        public static <T> Maybe<T> attempt(Maybe.ThrowingSupplier<T> runnable)
        Construct a Maybe from the execution of a function.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the function to run.
        Returns:
        A Maybe object containing either the return value of the function, or an exception of one occurred.

      • attempt

        public static Maybe<java.lang.Void> attempt(Maybe.ThrowingRunnable runnable)
        Construct a Maybe<Void> from the execution of a void function.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the function to run.
        Returns:
        A successful Maybe<Void> if the function run successfully, or an exception of one occurred.

      • map

        public <R> Maybe<R> map(Maybe.ThrowingFunction<T,R> function)
        Apply a transformation function if this Maybe is in a "successful" state. Pass through the exception in case it is in an "unsuccessful" state. If the transformation function throws, the exception is returned wrapped in an "unsuccessful" Maybe.
        Parameters:
        function - the function to apply
        Returns:
        A successful Maybe the new value if the transformation succeeds. An unsuccessful Maybe otherwise.

      • map

        public Maybe<java.lang.Void> map(Maybe.ThrowingConsumer<T> function)
        Apply a void function if this Maybe is in a "successful" state. Pass through the exception in case it is in an "unsuccessful" state. If the transformation function throws, the exception is returned wrapped in an "unsuccessful" Maybe. If it succeeds, return an empty Maybe<Void>.
        Parameters:
        function - the function to apply
        Returns:
        A successful Maybe<Void> if the function is executed and succeeds. An unsuccessful Maybe otherwise.

      • then

        public <R> Maybe<R> then(Maybe.ThrowingSupplier<R> runnable)
        Apply a function if this Maybe is in a "successful" state. Pass through the exception in case it is in an "unsuccessful" state. The function does not get the value of the Maybe passed as parameter, which is useful e.g. for chaining Maybe<Void>. If the function succeeds, its result is returned as a successful Maybe.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the function to apply
        Returns:
        A successful Maybe wrapping the return value if the function is executed and succeeds. An unsuccessful Maybe otherwise.

      • then

        public Maybe<java.lang.Void> then(Maybe.ThrowingRunnable runnable)
        Apply a void function if this Maybe is in a "successful" state. Pass through the exception in case it is in an "unsuccessful" state. The function does not get the value of the Maybe passed as parameter, which is useful e.g. for chaining Maybe<Void>. If the function succeeds, a successful empty Maybe<Void> is returned.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the function to apply
        Returns:
        A successful Maybe<Void> it the function is executed and succeeds. An unsuccessful Maybe otherwise.
